Before the construction of the first House Office Building, Cannon, members of Congress worked from their desks in the House chamber without staff.

Even in those days, the People's House competed in a lottery system for desk selection in which the Clerk pulled names from a box.

7/ Of course there's no way to know for sure whether the new gun law would have prevented this massacre, but the law is kind of tailor made for this scenario. 

The new law gives law enforcement the tools to connect the dots to prevent a shooting like this before it happens.

6/ A red flag order removes guns from the subject and prevents him from buying new guns. It lasts for 6 months and can be renewed.

If a red flag order had been issued in 2020, when Crimo started buying guns, it could have still been in effect today.

5/ The Illinois red flag law allows police to obtain an order (even without the consent of the parents), and with additional funding (also part of the new gun law), it's likely the Highland Park Police would have known that this was a text book case for a red flag order.

4/ But under the new law, each time Crimo bought a gun in 2020, the FBI would have been required to call the Highland Park Police to notify them.

This would have been key information, bc now the Highland Park Police would know that this dangerous kid was stockpiling weapons.

3/ In 2020, Crimo began to buy military style guns. Under current law, the FBI simply checks criminal databases and if there is no arrest (which there wasn't for Crimo), the sale goes through. So the Highland Park police likely didn't know this dangerous kid was buying guns.

2/ The Highland Park killer was known to police. In 2019 police interceded when Crimo tried to kill himself with a machete and again when he threatened to kill family members.

At the time, Crimo didn't own a gun, so a red flag law process wasn't relevant.

The new gun bill requires that local police be notified anytime a 18-20 yr old buys a gun. It also provides funding to help police better administer red flag laws.

These two provisions could have prevented the Highland Park shooting.
